Introduction for timed content.Message: Today's tip is about spending One-on-One Time with Our Children.
Introduction for timed content.Interaction message: Would you like to learn more about this tip?

Default introduction.Message: Invest in One-on-One Time! The more time you spend with your children, the more likely they will listen to you and behave well at other times. It really works!
Default introduction.Interaction message: Would you like to learn more about this tip?
Default introduction.Message for negative answer: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to receive more tips about how to manage your child's behaviour.

Video.Text: Here's a video about spending one-on-one time with your teen!

Audio.Text: Here's an audio message about spending one-on-one time with your teen!

Specific content for fathers and mothers.Message for fathers: Fathers can have difficult relationships with their teenagers, it can be hard to find pleasure from spending time with them. Instead, we spend a lot of time disciplining them or complaining about how they are behaving.
Specific content for fathers and mothers.Message for mothers: When we have difficult relationships with our teenagers, it can be hard to find pleasure from spending time with them. Instead, we spend a lot of time disciplining them or complaining about how they are behaving.
Specific content for fathers and mothers.Default message: When we have difficult relationships with our teenagers, it can be hard to find pleasure from spending time with them. Instead, we spend a lot of time disciplining them or complaining about how they are behaving.

Set of messages 1.Message: One-on-One Time with your teen helps build a positive and trusting relationship. When you really notice them and listen to what they are saying and what they like, you make them feel valued and appreciated.
Set of messages 1.Interaction message: Would you like to learn more?
Set of messages 1.Message for negative answer: That's okay! You can always type "Help" whenever you want to learn more about how to spend One-on-One Time with your teen. Chat to you later!

List of tips.Message: Here are 6 tips on how to make One-on-One Time a positive experience for you and your teen:

Option 1: Do it every day.Message:
1. Do it every day
Set aside a specific time to spend One-on-One Time with your teen each day. Choose a time when you and our teen will not be interrupted and when your teen does not have something else that they want to do, like watching TV or playing with phones.

Option 2: Let your teen choose the activ.Message 1:
2. Let your teen choose the activity
Tell your teen that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. Your teen might think this is weird at first but will come to enjoy having this dedicated time with you!
Option 2: Let your teen choose the activ.Message 2: Try to do something different than watching TV or playing with a tablet/phone. However, you may need to at first join your teen and watch their favourite TV programme with them. They may feel comfortable doing other activities with time.

Option 3: Follow your teen's lead.Message:
3. Follow your teen's lead
Try to follow your teen's lead during One-on-One Time. Accept their suggestions. Remember this is your teen's activity. Your job is to show an interest and say something nice.

Option 4: Give your teen your full atten.Message 1:
4. Give your teen all of your attention. 
Switch off the television and put away phones. Make sure you can give all of your attention to your teen.
Option 4: Give your teen your full atten.Message 2: Look at your teen. Nodding or “I see” shows your teen you are really paying attention. Accept what they are saying without judging them.

Option 5: Show your teen you are really.Message:
5. Show your teen you are really listening

You can even try rephrasing back what your teen says when they speak to you. For example, when your teen says, “This math problem is really hard,” you can say, “Yeah, I see that you are finding it difficult.” It shows you are really listening to them and will make them feel supported.

Option 6: Have fun!.Message:
6. Have fun!
One-on-One Time with your teen can be fun for you, too! You might even find that you feel less stressed after spending time with your teen.

List of tips.Message for choosing another tip: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to spend One-on-One Time with your teen:
